properties.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued January 11 at 4:13AM EST until January 12 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Freezing rain producing ice accumulations around one
quarter inch are expected. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph,
which may further increase briefly Sunday morning.

* WHERE...Livingston and Oakland Counties.

* WHEN...From 4 AM Saturday to 7 AM EST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the
ice and strong winds. Travel could become nearly impossible.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures are expected to fall to near
freezing this afternoon or early evening. The forecast for
freezing rain remains extremely sensitive to how far south the
sub-freezing air advances today and its timing. There will
likely be a sharp north to south gradient in ice accumulation
totals across Livingston and Oakland Counties.
properties.instruction:
Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra
flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an
emergency. Prepare for possible power outages.

NWSheadline: ICE STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SUNDAY
